page.title: 02POPULATION
page.content: The{people}of the area live in scattered farms and cottages. Only at Rhydycroesau and Pant Glas is a handful of houses grouped together to form a hamlet. Rhydycroesau alone has a population sufficient to justify a post office/general store. Farm cottages once occupied by farm labourers working on the Harlech estate are now keenly sought by those wishing to live out of the nearby town of Oswestry. These cottages are in a good state of repair, and many have been modernised and extended.{Gardening}is a popular hobby, with floral displays adding to the natural colour of the area, and well-kept vegetable patches providing a useful supplement to the household diet.
